facts.description: U.S. District Judge Steven Merryday dismissed Trump's $15 billion defamation lawsuit against the New York Times.
facts.context: The judge criticized the lawsuit as 'decidedly improper and impermissible' and set a limit on any amended complaint.

facts.description: Polls indicate a significant drop in Trump's approval rating and growing pessimism among Republicans about the country's direction.
facts.context: The share of American adults who believe the country is off track increased from 62% to 75% since June.

facts.description: Democratic lawmakers are increasingly opposing Trump's actions, with Illinois Governor J.B. Pritzker stating that Trump's rhetoric is 'un-American.'
facts.context: Pritzker argues that Trump is destabilizing the country to erode democratic institutions.

facts.description: Since January, over 400 lawsuits have been filed against the Trump administration, with courts halting policies in more than 100 cases.
facts.context: Litigation has been a successful avenue for challenging Trump's policies.

habits.description: Democratic lawmakers are conducting oversight and demanding accountability for the Trump administration's actions.
habits.context: This includes introducing reforms and a constitutional amendment to address campaign finance issues.

habits.description: Representative Jason Crow emphasizes the importance of everyday citizens standing up for democracy.
habits.context: He highlights the courage of individuals who have defended democratic values in various situations.

references.title: Judge dismisses Trump's lawsuit against New York Times
Court listener for Trump v. New York Times
